I'm a designer based out of Albuquerque, New Mexico. I have been working as a graphic and user interface designer for over twenty years and have spent the last four years developing web sites and interfaces for University of New Mexico School of Law.

Fun with XML, XSLT and OWL

Nov 24, 2017 • Jayson Capps

My goal was to use the News Story Index/XML generated by Cascade and modify one of the News Formats developed by UCAM to show only new stories that contained the keyword, "Students". Below is the page region where I placed the "News Story" Index Block and newly created "News Format - Student News - OWL" format.

Here is the code for the XSLT. I modified the “_common/v2/formats/news/News Main Page”.

I then used Owl Carousel to wrap and display the news stories. I used a carousel for its flexibility. I needed a container that would be able to display 5-30 possible news items while still being able to display them in a single row within a grid layout.

To see the live project, please go to the UNM School of Law Campus Life page.
